review.reviewBody: The first thing I noticed was that they are not as soft as the other pants I’ve purchased in the past. Second is that that these are WAY longer than all my other beyond yoga pants. I do love the color and overall fit.
review.name: POWERBEYOND™ Strive Bootcut Pant.

review.reviewBody: These, imo, have a very strange cut and fit. The original boot cut is a much better design. Had to return.
review.name: Strive boot cut

review.reviewBody: These pants accentuated my belly. Other brands’ leggings — even without compression — do a better job of flattering my shape.
review.name: Not flattering

review.reviewBody:
I have been buying from beyond yoga for 12 years 
And I am very disappointed in your
Choice of fabric.
I have been a customer loyal customer. because it was a company started by women and you use cotton. Now you’re using polyester and synthetic fabrics which is actually a huge disappointment.
review.name: Choice of fabrics

review.reviewBody: Material is quality, for sure, but outrageously long! Im 5'7", 180 lbs. Size Large was several inches below my ankle. Also - the material has sheen, which shows all the dimples. I wish these were like SpaceDye, which is lighter weight, matte and....no cellulite seen. Disappointed!
review.name: Way too long an fabric unflattering

review.reviewBody: I’m not sure why my Beyond Yoga XS boot cut soft yoga pants (purple) fit perfectly, but my PowerBeyond Yoga XS boot cut pants (black) were nearly impossible to slide over my hips. I could actually hear the seams popping. Yes, I kept them!
review.name: Inconsistent sizing

review.reviewBody: I weigh 107, 36” hips and I can’t even pull the small up over my hips
review.name: Can’t get them on

name: Powerbeyond Strive Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Helium Insulated Hooded Plus Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I live in California. But I'm always cold. My husband was determined to find me warm clothes of excellent quality. He put me online and talked about these puffer-like jackets. I was hesitant because a size 1X in a puffy jacket has not been my go-to look. BUT, these are not so puffy. They are thin and comfortable and so, so warm! And the color. I call it tangerine. It's a really great color. I get compliments every time I wear it. I wear it over my scrubs for work. I wear it over Tshirt and jeans on the weekends. I'm just thrilled with the technology that makes this thin, but warm. I am so happy to not add an extra size or two to my frame that a traditional puffy jacket would do. Am overall very happy to wrap myself with, as and cuddle with my jacket....my tangerine cuddler
review.name: Luvluvluv my Tangerine Cuddler

review.itemreviewed: Helium Insulated Hooded Plus Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I should have listened to reviews about the strange fit of this jacket because they are spot on. While the jacket is nice, the fit is too far off to keep. This jacket is really close around the hips (so close I wouldn't be able to layer much underneath) but the upper arms are far too big. Not only does this make for a strange fit, it looks so odd on the body. This one went back same day and am going on three weeks waiting for refund. :(
review.name: Nice jacket but can't get past awful fit

review.itemreviewed: Helium Insulated Hooded Plus Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have never had a jacket that is so incredibly functional, fits so well, and is ORANGE. It packs down pretty small, is pretty lightweight, yet is warm and lightly waterproof and just good for everything. I've climbed in it and skied in it and hiked in it. I wore it many times a week for a whole year and only got one little wear spot on one elbow (patched with tape now). I love how it fits, and how it breathes enough to wear on chilly days when I'm climbing so I can keep warm while belaying and not have to take it on and off. I love the zipper pockets and helmet compatible hood.
review.name: My favorite jacket I've ever owned

review.itemreviewed: Helium Insulated Hooded Plus Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I cannot comment enough on how perfect this puffy is for my body. I almost cried when I zipped it up for the first time without having to suck in my belly. I was truly WARM in it (versus other puffy jackets that are too tight and prevent warming air circulation). I'm so thankful OR designed a line of plus size technical gear for those of us in big bodies. GET THIS JACKET RIGHT NOW.
review.name: FINALLY! The perfect plus size puffy!

name: Helium Insulated Hooded Plus Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a high quality garment that lives up to the price tag. It stays fresh even after a few wears and is perfect for travel. It does attract a lot of lint but the comfort and utility of this shirt outweighs that for me.

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Bear Lift Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has been my go to shirt for everything from hanging out at home to walking, hiking and every kind of outdoor activity. A perfect blend of breathability, durability and warmth. Great value!
review.name: Perfect shirt for every activity

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Bear Lift Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought these in men's & women's for a 3 week trekking adventure. These shirts are awesome. You can easily rinse to freshen up when you have access to running water, they dry quickly and don't hold any funky smell, perfect for travel. We took 2 for each of us, so that one could be rinsed/dried and the other worn. Excellent purchase & worth the price. Weight is heavy enough to wear like a regular T (vs undershirt) but light enough to keep you cool on warm days & dry quickly when washed. Highly recommend.
review.name: Best T

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Bear Lift Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like it. It's become a T-shirt I look forward to wearing so I'm back for more!
review.name: Nice shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Bear Lift Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall the shirt will do what you are buying it for. It's not a fashion shirt that you will wear in daily life to look good. It's a shirt you will take on long term travel or doing outdoor adventures and it fits and looks like that. I will say it doesn't look bad, I would wear it out in town while traveling, but if you're looking for something that you'll wear to look good in daily this ain't it.
review.name: It's what you're expecting

description: Buy the Camp Chef Barbecue Box with Lid online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Barbecue Box with Lid
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Barbecue Box with Lid online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been using my BBQ grill box with my Explorer for 10+ years.  It has been used as an every-day grill, camping grill, party grill, baseball tournament grill, etc...very heavy usage. Zero issues. I estimate that I have prepared over 300 meals with it. The grill box has now worn out (the grate plate below the cooking surface finally rusted and broke through and is coming apart).  I just ordered another BBQ grill box and expect another 10 years and 300 meals - thanks!
review.name: Simple and Effective!

review.reviewBody: Purchased this 14" grill box online and received it at the end of September 2021.  After 1 use, grill grate is warped and paint is peeling from corners of lid. Not impressed! save your money and purchase a quality product made in North America, not overseas. I should have known better.
review.name: very poor quality
comment: Hello and thank you for your review. We want to assure you that we truly are a company that stands behind their products and take pride in our customer support. Our products have a variety of warranties. Please reach out to customer service at support@campchef.com or 1-800-650-2433 and they will be happy to help as quickly as possible.

review.reviewBody: I am so glad I ordered this Grill, it has been a blast cooking on it for my wife and I.
review.name: For just the two of us and for more than two also

review.reviewBody: I really enjoy using this after smoking steak.....
review.name: Great add-on

review.reviewBody: It cooks great on either my side kick (great for the reverse sear) or my two burner stove. Love that the lid also fits perfectly on my flat top griddle. Very versatile.
review.name: Love the lid

review.reviewBody: We have carried this with our Camp Chef stove for a number of years.  Its great for gilling food on the stove for times when you cannot use a fire etc. I highly recommend the naylon case to protect other equipment from the grime of the grill and to prevent the grill from acquiring more dirt and dust
review.name: Great accessory for use with the Camp Chef stove

review.reviewBody: I love how this grill cooks so evenly, and doesn't burn the food.
review.name: Perfect, even cooking.

review.reviewBody: Took me almost an hour to cook 3 hamburgers. Just doesn't get hot enough.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody: The only part of this grill box that wears out is the heat dispersing pan just below the cooking grate, but is the only part that cannot be purchased for replacement.  What gives?
review.name: spare parts

review.reviewBody: I have not actually used the grill box as of yet, but I have unboxed it, and gave it a good looking over. This thing is heavy duty, just like all of my Camp Chef stuff, the cast iron grill accounts for a good deal of the heft. I bought my Yukon stove at a local home improvement store as a impulse purchase, I saw it and thought, I want one. I bought the reversible griddle and the huge water pot, plus chef's spatula's for it, which made using the stove a total joy. I love the stove, but adding the grill box is going to make it way better. It only makes sense to get this accessory for the stove. Next week, on Memorial weekend, I have the first big family outing planned, I'm excited to fire up the stove and put the grill box to use.
review.name: Makes perfect sense to get this...

name: Barbecue Box with Lid

description: Buy the Topeak D-Torq Wrench online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: D-Torq Wrench
hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak D-Torq Wrench online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: A nice addition to the tool kit. Mine has a handy set of allen wrench/sockets included in the well-padded carrying case. Makes a satisfying beep when you hit the correct torque. Highly recommended!
review.name: Simple and effective

review.reviewBody:
Easy to use.  Reversible, which is not a feature on many torque tools.  Loud limit beep.  
The only caution I have is the battery cap can be put in 180 degrees out - which prevents the contacts from, ahem, contacting.  So it seems like the battery (AAA) is dead, when the cap just needs to be put in correctly by aligning the dots.
review.name: A must!

review.reviewBody: Great tool for all my jobs on my mountain bike. Was able to disassemble and reassemble my bike frame and rear shock link for service with no problems. Also great for cockpit and saddle adjustments.  Digital reading and over torque alarm are really handy. Only suggestion is to include more bits/attachments with this tool. It only comes with 6 and you usually need more for a full bike tear down and rebuild.
review.name: Awesome Tool

name: D-Torq Wrench

hasVariant.description: Buy the Kali Protectives Mission 2.0 Knee Guard online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I tried on several pads before buying.  I compared these with the 7 protection Sam Hill Lite, the 100% Teratec and the Fox Enduro D3O.  These were the most comfortable for me.  Most of the others had extremely long sleeves or were really hot just trying on in the store.

I've done a lot of trail riding with these and don't feel like they are too hot.  They stay on well and are comfortable.  They have silicon inside to hold them in place.  They're not super tight right around the knee, so I was worried they would slide on a crash.  Had one crash and they stayed in place and protected me well.
review.name: They do the job

review.reviewBody: Finally coming back to review these after having them over a year. This is my favorite chamois for mountain biking! The pad has perfect support where it's needed and is thin and breathable everywhere it's not. I had tried several different brands in search of a waist band that didn't dig into my stomach, and this one has the most comfortable design by far. The material is comfortable, breathable, and stays in place over long rides. The legs don't ride up at all, but also don't leave elastic ring marks around my thighs after a long ride. They've stayed in great shape over a year of heavy use.
review.name: My favorite chamois!

review.itemreviewed: Kestrel BOA Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are advertised for "downcountry" type riding, and I would totally agree that is their optimal performance window. They are lightweight and offer great power transfer to the pedals with a reasonably stiff sole. At the same time, their construction is robust enough with adequate protection with toe and heel bumpers that they should last for many seasons of riding and rock bashing. They are comfortable and stable to walk in when off the bike too, and the tread has good grip on loose terrain. I have two minor complaints: 1.) I wish the cleat pocket was a little deeper, as my SPD cleats hit the ground when walking on a flat surface such as a floor; and 2.) the two Velcro straps could be bit longer and heavier duty, as it's more work to secure them tightly than it should be. Overall, I really like these shoes!
review.name: Great shoes for downcountry riding!

review.itemreviewed: Kestrel BOA Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoe for trail riding and fits perfectly between xc and enduro. Not too light, not too bulky and more comfortable (for me) than the Giro and Sidi's I've had over the years.
review.name: Perfect Trail Shoe

review.reviewBody: Very easy to use. Locking/Unlocking is very smooth

review.reviewBody: I've had this lock since April of 2020 and unfortunately it stopped working a little over a year later. It was great when it worked--lightweight, super durable and packed down easily into my back jersey pocket or tucked away in a backpack. For a $50 lock I was hoping it would last longer, but unfortunately the lock is completely stuck at this point. UPDATE: I contacted Ottolocks customer service and they are sending me a new lock, free of charge. The breakaway button was activated on my lock, rendering it unusable.Thank you Ottolock! They have great customer service and I am stoked to have this lock again, it truly is the best one that I've found in terms of size, strength and function.

description: Buy the Silca Secret Chain Blend - Hot Wax online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Secret Chain Blend - Hot Wax
hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Secret Chain Blend - Hot Wax online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I recently decided to make the switch to waxed chains, and I know I'll never go back. The up-front cost isn't exactly cheap if you get the good stuff, but the cost is worth it for the performance, increased life-span of components, and long-term savings. Silca is a premium brand with a premium price, but you get what you pay for. I've been very happy with this wax. Combined with their Waxing Systems, the job becomes pretty simple after a few reps. Highly recommended!
review.name: My drivetrain will never be the same

review.reviewBody: Beware of very long break in period when starting with a new DA 12 speed chain (not an issue with my 11 speed, may have something to do with the coatings). Stiff chain and skipping cog for 1 hour. 11T still skipping under load for 3.5-4 hours.
review.name: Extremely long chain break in Duraace 12

review.reviewBody: I switched to waxing pre-covid ( a date now?)  I started on my wifes bike to eliminate the chainring tatoo on her right calf.  Then I moved to my "pavement princess" roadbike and really like the quietness and cleanliness.  After some use, I realized that although the wax is only good for say 500 road miles in dry without touching, the re-application is super easy b/c you just redunk in the hot wax, I DON'T clean before redunking.  My chain has been lasting longer to, I keep checking the "wear indicator" but it's not wearing, maybe my wear indicator is broken.  As a hint, if you go this way, when the chain comes out, let it cool.  Then pull it around a 1" rod, I use my roll around garbage can lid, and pull both rotational directions a bit to "free the chain up" then lightly shake or brush and it'll get most of the excess outside wax off.  The chain is ready to install and good for hundred's of miles.  I've switched now on my MTB for wet and nasty, I actually think this is still working better than liquid lubricants there to, but I need more time to test that.  Good Luck.
review.name: secret chain blend wax for bike chains

review.reviewBody: Waxing a chain seemed like overkill and a hassle but I'm really glad I switched over to wax.  I don't know if I'm any faster but my drive train is much quieter.  Not having a dirty chain is a big plus and I don't have to worry about lubing my chain on regular basis.  Most of my rides are on dry gravel so having a dry lube chain works for me.  I'm thinking about keeping a wet chain around as a backup for those times when I'm riding in wet and/or muddy conditions.
review.name: Nice clean way to lube your drivetrain

name: Secret Chain Blend - Hot Wax

review.reviewBody:
I bought this 2 weeks ago and overall, they are a nice pair of climbing shoes. I climb indoors and these are my 3rd ever pair of climbing shoes. Very comfortable.

Some things I would note are that I thought they would be more aggressive going by all of the images of all the versions of Geshidos - regular, LV, lace. Pretty soft rubber and overall doesn't hold that arched shape when they are broken in. My main pair are the Phantoms and these feel drastically different. I wanted a less aggressive pair to switch off with.

If you're looking for something a little more aggressive, I would not recommend. if you're getting into doing more technical stuff without jumping to a super aggressive pair, these are great.
review.name: Good shoes for intermediate climbers

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing these shoes for over a year pretty regularly rotating them with the shamans and I still have not blown through them. Really love these shoes as an all around technical shoe. Will buy again for sure. My only complaint is I wish they weren’t pink. Tired of gender defined coloring on shoes.
review.name: Great all around use shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these 6ish months ago and loved them, they performed great on the walls. They are also a good mix between slightly aggressive but still comfortable for the feet. I made the mistake of purchasing a different style of shoe after I had worn through these, and I regret not purchasing these again. Now that I have officially worn through the pair I purchased after, I am definitely buying these Geshido's again.
review.name: Good Performance

review.reviewBody: I've got a somewhat narrow heel and happy to have found these fit really well and can heel hook and they are really secure feeling and no dead space.   This has been an issue with most shoes I've tried.  Went off of the recommendation of going with your street shoe size and glad I did.  They are tight but they broke in and good for me for sport climbing and in the gym.
review.name: Great all around shoe

name: Geshido Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've had dozens of hats over the decades, and this is a perfect one when I'm generating some heat from exercise (hiking, skiing). (A warmer hat's needed for standing around in cold weather.)
review.name: A perfect hat

review.reviewBody: It is a very technically designed product therefore it appears difficult to wear it for theater and dinner evenings. So should it be used 'outdoor'? All right: but then it is too thin: chill and wind easily pass through it and head freezes. Parka's hoodie over it, is necessary to reach a basic comfort. In itself is a good product; only be aware it does not carry itself alone, the burdens winter let you experience, despite the name inducing to believe.
review.name: Not a frost line

review.reviewBody: I need it to close snuggly under my chin and it does not.
review.name: If the Velcro is improved

review.reviewBody: I really wish I loved this but the ear flaps are too small and the Velcro rarely stays attached and usually requires 2 hands to attach... tough to do while holding onto a dog sled. The fit is decent and the cinch on the back is nice. I was expecting a bit more functionality for the money and from OR
review.name: Meh...

review.reviewBody: Great overall hat to pack for light trips . Light , does the job on high wind and I've used the mouth cover a few times when it's really ripping through. It could be a little deeper wear by having the hat while ear flaps are up have the overall come down more a bit over the ears , and to add vents in the mouth part would be a good add. This hat is well worth the money, so far daily use for me .
review.name: Easy to wear , not bulky

review.reviewBody: It's very warm and wind/rain-proof. My only complaint is that the chinstrap does not connect very well. There needs to be a stronger connection.
review.name: Almost great.

review.reviewBody: Great product, obviously a lot of thought put into the design however as several reviewers have indicated, the fit runs small. I have this in an XL and it runs tight (even after a haircut). Please consider offering this in a XXL size. Kind regards-
review.name: Need to offer in XXL

review.reviewBody: I work as a Polar Expedition Guide and got this hat for work, especially in Antarctica. I LOVED the hat but HATED the velcro on the chin straps! I use this hat with the OR SONIC BALACLAVA for bomb-proof polar protection of my head and neck. I only problem I had was that the chin straps were not long enough and the velcro was not strong enough! I notified OR about this hoping that a change would be made on future designs but unfortunately the design was left the same. I did not want to return my hat so removed the OR velcro from the chin straps, bought some stronger velcro and had it sewn to the straps! Now it works great and even Antarctic katabatibc winds can't rip it off my head!
review.name: Great hat if you hack it yourself!

review.reviewBody: My daughter grabbed one of these hats off the shelf and asked "Daddy, can you buy me one of these hats?". I did and she loved it so much that she convinced me to buy one too. I am so glad I did as it's my all time favorite winter hat. I live in Colorado and spend every weekend in the mountains between 10k and 14k feet. I wear this hat for every outing from mountaineering, ice climbing, hiking and belaying when not wearing a helmet. It is warm, versatile and comfortable. I have used this hat down to -5 without needing another layer.
review.name: The best winter hat I have ever owned

review.reviewBody: I got this hat for work as we are outside most of the day in those -30 to -40 canadian cold. So far it has held up really good, keeps me very warm. I like that I can bring it to different level of warm and adjust according to the temperature. If it's milder I just lift the sides, but as the temperature drops I drop the sides. On nights when it get really cold, I add the mask and don't feel the cold at all. My management approved the style as they thought it looked professional with the uniform. I read the reviews prior to purchasing, and went for a bigger size. I am usually a size small, and M or L would fit perfectly.
review.name: Great har to work outdoors

name: Frostline Hat - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Favorite hiking and playing pants for any fall/ spring/ cooler summer weather. Great in winter over base layer if we don’t want to do full snow suit. 

Great quality - we just spent an hour on a slab rock, sliding on the bum, no tears to fabric at all. 

Love the adjustable waist on my tall and slender kid.
review.name: Favorite cool weather pants.

review.reviewBody:
Warmer than I thought - or at least my kids have been wearing these in -15C weather with a warm pair of long johns without complaint. Great mobility and easy to put on, very durable. Love the visibility. A great product for shoulder season and even mild winter weather.
5 fits my 6 year old daughter (who is on the short size) very well and 9 fits my 9 year old perfects (she is an average height for her age) and they both have very different body types
review.name: great outdoors pants

review.reviewBody: They run small. I bought the same size as what he uses. And they all are tight. Had to return it. Other
Preschooler says they are comfortable, warm and kept her dry playing in the melting snow. Big bonus that they came in a fun color!
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: The pants are comfortable and protect well against the wind and rain. I’m planning to order another pair for both my kids!
review.name: Great addition to winter wardrobe

review.reviewBody: I am from Norway, and in Norway the kids are outside all year around. And there is a lot of weather! Reima is considered one of the best quality clothes for children! It last, keeps them warm and their design is loved by the children. So happy to find them in the US!
review.name: Reima -quality for kids

hasVariant.name: 100MW Titanium Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Columbia 100MW Titanium Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: comfortable from the start. great gripping soles, laces lock so they hold your foot in place.
review.name: great comfortable boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this. I went a half size bigger, instead of 7.5, I bought a size 8. I was hiking yesterday for 5 hours and my feet were not sore at all even the day after. It is very comfy. Definitely great to wear for hiking. It is so worth the price.
review.name: Worth the price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like these boots, & purple is my favorite color! I was looking for a boot to support my feet & ankles, while accommodating a heavier sock. This hiking boot does just that! I also chose them for the waterproof feature for winter & spring hiking. I appreciate that they are so lightweight, especially for being waterproof. I ordered a half size larger than I normally wear to accommodate thicker, padded, hiking socks, and to avoid the pinching of the toes going downhill. Overall a good, sturdy, supportive hiking boot.
review.name: Good, sturdy hiking boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered these with the hopes of breaking them in before a big hike, but ended up hiking 15 miles in these boots straight out of the box and they were great! Super cute and feminine hiking boots that get the job done. I ordered a 6.5 and I normally wear a 6 in shoes, these fit well with hiking socks— a little big but I’ve always heard of ordering a half size bigger for hiking, so no complaints here. I’d say true to size for sure!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought them for my wife as a gift, summer is around the corner and we love to hike ! The shoes are the perfect gift for her, she will enjoy more going out to nature
review.name: Excellent Gift

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes are comfortable. However, the material along the top of the shoe is thin and an eyelet rubs on the top of my foot. I'm hoping over time the leather will stretch a bit and allow for more room.
review.name: Comfy but eyelet rubs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are my first pair of Columbia hiking boots and l am very happy with my purchase!! My husband and l enjoy exploring every Sunday morning in AZ and wonder the mountains in Estrella for at least 7 miles and my hiking boots are so comfortable that l feel like l am walking on clouds! I wear a 6.5 runner but went to a 7 because I like a thicker hiking socks. I like the light weight of the hiking boots and color!
review.name: Like hiking on clouds!

name: 100MW Titanium Outdry Hiking Boot - Women's

hasVariant.name: Reactor Coffee Press

hasVariant.name: Reactor Coffee Press
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Reactor Coffee Press online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Beats my Moca pot for weight savings and works great for backcountry coffee.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I do my fair share of back country hiking and multiple day canoe trips. I also crave good coffee. The Reactor Coffee Press allows me to enjoy a great cup of coffee no matter where life takes me. Great product, I high recommend it.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: It wasn't until I had pressed my first coffee in this until I found that there was no way to pour it out! I guess I have an older version of the reactor, and newer versions appear to have a strainer built into the lid. Without this, there is no way to pour the coffee. This is very disappointing; I wish I had have read the reviews here before purchasing, as it appears I'm not the only one who has had this problem. I assumed it was compatible with all 1.7L reactors, as it didn't state anywhere in the description that it isn't.
review.name: Beware: Doesn't work with all Reactors

review.reviewBody: I purchased the coffee press attachment earlier this season and am very impressed. This is my preferred method of making coffee whether I am base camping, car camping or backpacking due to its portability and ability to make coffee for the entire group. I really love that the coffee press attachment can be stored inside the put with the stove and fuel. I use the 1.7L system and would highly recommend this for couples and for groups up to four people. You can check out my video on my Youtube channel Lone Crow Adventures for a detailed look at this system.
review.name: Great for trail coffee

review.reviewBody: I love this stove, but this accessory needs some work. The rubber seel has become mishaped over the years and has never worked as good as a real french press. Can't poor with plunger and rod in place. I would suggest MSR take note from other french presses and incorporate them into this accessory. I'm gonna buy a separate french presses that is light weight .
review.name: Work for a while.

review.reviewBody: Packed the Reactor on a recent boating trip. Usually I opt for the monster coffee press on river trips but on this trip I wanted something simple. The Reactor Coffee Press was super straight forward to setup and making coffee took half the time than usual. Nice product if you need coffee to get going and want to bring a french press along.
review.name: Fast way to make french press coffee in the morning

review.reviewBody: While the Reactor stove is an amazing piece of kit in its own right, the coffee press was the selling point for us. We have tried many different presses with a variety of stoves or pots, THIS is our favorite!
review.name: Selling Point

review.reviewBody: I use it with the 1.7l Version and love to brew my home ground grains with it. Everything works perfect. I even feel that I find less powder on the bottom of the Cup as with my Bodum home press. It fits nicely in the DeepDish bowl which then dissapears on the bottom of the pot. Brilliant Piece of kit.
review.name: Best Coffee outside ever had

review.reviewBody: This is by far the first MSR product that I'm not completely pleased with, poor design from top to bottom. First, the plunger is help in place by rubber that is was to flexible. Second, there's virtually no way to pour the coffee without trying to remove the lid.
review.name: Needs Work!

name: Reactor Coffee Press

review.reviewBody: I ordered the martini olive color and in the ad it has a large mountain over the chest area with Burton underneath. Mine came with a tiny little mountain up in the left hand portion of the chest. Otherwise, material and color are great. Thumb hooks inside sleeves are nice. Super soft inside. Splashed some water on it and it all beaded and rolled off nicely. I’m 6’ 2” 190lbs and the large fits perfectly, maybe just a touch baggy lengthwise in the sleeves but better than too short. Overall it’s great, just would have preferred the big mountain like in the photo printed on the hoodie. Hoodie is 5/5. Just had to dock one point for a different print than advertised.
review.name: Different image on actual hoodie

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: This mat is thin and way over priced for what it is. You can buy the same exact product for less than 1/3 of this price.
review.name: Over priced plastic mat

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the double air chamber. The Matt is so comfortable it’s like you aren’t even camping.
review.name: I love the double air

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Extremely comfortable and warm. Glad I got the xt, willing to sacrifice weight and bulk.
review.name: Extremely comfortable and warm. Glad

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] this thing is very warm, very comfortable. The stuff sack inflator is not easy to use. the pad is very easy to blow up with your mouth. I am plannig to buy a compression sack for this, I am pretty sure i can get it to pack down smaller
review.name: awesome matt - weird stuff sack

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I loved the pad and how comfy it is and thick , but it only lasted two days before the bottom layer began to loose air, luckily the second layer prevented me from sleeping on the ground but, before this I had a thermarest that lasted me 5 years of many big walls, backpacking trips and sleeping on it for 14 days in a row for work. Disappointed my comfort deluxe plus didn’t even make it 2 days especially for the price.
review.name: Great pad but not Durable

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Absolutely the most comfortable pad I’ve ever had. Love how small it packs down for our canoe tripping. I got the large and it’s wonderful. The dual layer is phenomenal allowing personalized adjustments for the ground and your comfort. Can’t say enough good things about this pad. Have used it three years in a row now, for our summer excursions. Fantastic.
review.name: Love this!

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I got this for my 69th birthday! The ground had been getting pretty hard these last few years. This pad is amazing! It distributed my weight evenly whether on my back or side. No sore spots. My sheets didn?t slip and I was warm all night long! It is deluxe for sure!
review.name: I can enjoy sleeping on the ground again

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I slept on this in the BWCA for 5 nights. Two other people in my group went cheap on their sleeping pads and they popped the first night out. I was comfortable and warm each night, and they froze their butts off and cursed themselves for going cheap. This was our first time ever visiting the BWCA and my first time ever camping in what I would call an extreme way. One of the many things we learned was just how important your sleep system is. I can't praise this mat enough. I slept great for all but one night, and the one night I didn't was because I was too hot in my bivy bag and I couldn't vent it because of the mosquitoes. This had nothing to do with the pad.
review.name: Great pad

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I haven't slept on it yet but when I lyed down on it, it is very noisy and I think that will really bother me. It is like laying on crackly cellophane
review.name: very noisy!

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Used mine for the first time on a turkey hunt in WI in May. Very light and warm. Love the two chamber design so I don't need to worry about leaks. Great design on the bag pump. Obviously a first run, but it was great.
review.name: Great sleeping pad.

name: Comfort Plus XT Insulated Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.name: Biggie Blanket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Biggie Blanket online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I wasn't sure what to expect when I ordered the blanket.  

What showed up is a big camping blanket, it isn't something for hiking, but, for sitting out under the stars, or camping it would be awesome. 

I like using it when we watch movies outside on the deck, It is big enough for my wife, the dog and myself. 

It has a smooth nylon side which is the screen printed cream colored side and then the thin soft fleece side which is the green side. 

Would I recommend the blanket? Yes, 

I also think it is good bang for the buck.
review.name: The thing is big and it is warm.

review.reviewBody: Our puppy cuddled up in this,  and the dog hair brushes right off! Such a cool design,  and so warm by the fire! #backcountrygearhead #ursaminor
review.name: Ursa loves it too

review.reviewBody: Super warm and cozy, great for long road trips, warmer camping nights, and hammock naps!
review.name: Perfect camping blanket

review.reviewBody: Just got this a week ago and took it out tent/car camping in the mountains over the weekend where we live in Big Bear Lake Ca. Over night low was 41 degrees. We slept on top of our double sleeping bag and threw the blanket on top of us. We never even needed to get inside of the sleeping bag! This nice oversized blanket keep us perfectly warm and cozy all night long! I am going to buy a second one to keep in my RV. This blanket ROCKS! I can not say enough good things about it ! Just get one NOW ! This will be your most favorite blankie  ever!!!
review.name: THIS BLANKET ROCKS!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my son for camping. Nice comfy blanket. large enough for 2
review.name: Camping

name: Biggie Blanket

review.reviewBody: My granddaughter wanted this particular North Face Jacket. I stumbled on the BackCounty website and there was the jacket at this amazing price. She was all smiles when she opened her gift and that always brings a smile to my heart to see her happy. The jacket was great quality and fit her perfectly. Thanks BackCountry to help me be the “Best Grandma”.
review.name: Best Grandma

review.reviewBody: True to size and I got the size small. Love the style and I like the hood (hood is better than the Nuptse).
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Nice coat but not what I was looking for. I'm 5'5 123 pounds and it was a bit too short for my taste. Hits right at bottom of waist and rides up when arms go up. Well made but I returned it.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: This is my first purchase with Backcountry and am pleased with my jacket. Fits well and looks great.
review.name: Very Happy with Purchase

review.reviewBody: Great product. Fit is accurate and warm for the weight
review.name: Functional and form

review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket keeps my petite daughter warm on her walk to school. Color is fantastic.
review.name: Warm, classic jacket

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'0, 115lbs, 34DD, I have a very short torso, and this fits perfectly. The length of the coat sits at my hips and the sleeves don't go past my wrists! Also, VERY warm!
review.name: Perfect for petites!

review.reviewBody: Fit was perfect, so far it has kept me warm but we haven't hit real cold weather. Looks nice on.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: Nice looking, comfortable, but the cuffs are a bit hard and make my hands a bit discomfort.
review.name: Cuffs are a bit hard but overall cute

review.reviewBody: This product is great. My daughter loves it and it keeps her nice and warm.
review.name: I would buy this again!!

review.reviewBody:
This bar is somehow stiff, reactive and flexible all at the same time. They let me ride without my hands going numb or any other issues I've had before. I have been using it on a rigid 29er that I believe I would already have been rattled to pieces on without it. I never really noticed compliance until I had it on this bike. 
Pros:  
Stiff while being compliant to calm the chatter  
Same price as other carbon bars 
Lifetime warranty with a company that honors it  
Cons: 
None at all

I also paired them with the enve stem. You get what you pay for.. BTW I'm a sucker for matching my bike colors. With the included decals you can match these bars to most bikes.

review.reviewBody: Overall, these are warm mitts that are great for post activity type stuff, i.e. hanging out by a camp fire. But they are far from waterproof. I'd only consider bringing them in the backcountry if I knew for sure I wouldn't need to have my hand in the snow too much. I wore them unburying my car from snow and they were pretty wet. Pretty bummed as I was hoping to use them x-country skiing this year.
review.name: Warm but not waterproof

review.reviewBody: When I first received these, I though I probably should have spent the crazy money for serious waterproof gore tex type megamittens, but turns out these are more than adequate for almost all my skiing situations. Paired with thin gore tex liner gloves that I use year round, these became the perfect outer layer that I could take off on steep skins on warm days, but also kept my hands toasty on gnarly cold windy lift rides. Gripped poles well and slid through the loops when I needed those. Yay. But their value for me is really over the liner - on their own, I wouldn't trust them for any backcountry missions or serious cold.
review.name: Not hardcore, but plenty good enough!

review.reviewBody: These gloves are fantastic for any kind of outdoor activity. I use these hiking, cross country skiing, walking, running and snowshoeing. They are also warm enough that I can use them driving too and from work or anywhere. They are light weight but super warm. I used them when it was -30C and was never cold, the only thing is that I would actually over heat a little in them but I'd rather that than be too cold. They are waterproof as well which is awesome
review.name: I Love These Gloves

review.reviewBody: Given the placement of the narrowing for the wrist and the length of the fingers, the corner that meets the space between my thumb and index finger was in the wrong place. The size seemed fine, but they were the wrong shape for my hands.
review.name: Wrong shape for my hands

name: Shadow Mitten - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Jones MTB BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been using these boots for 12 months and probably have about 100 tours on them. The first pair only lasted me 1 month before they had to be replaced due to the internal routing for the BOA cable failing causing the BOA cable to become stuck, fusterating by Backcountry.com worked to warranty them and were able to get me replacements fast. The second pair have about 11 months on them not and they are basically shredded to pieces. The liners have worn badly against the stablizing plastic peices - that can be swapped for varying stiffnesess - to the point that the liner has a hole in it. There is also significant wear in the interior of the liner around my ankle due to frcition created primarily in walk mode. The boots are absolutley not too big for me, if anything I would in retrospect go up a half size to a full size, yet the ankle lock is not able to prevent significant wear to the liner. Finally, the overall build quality is poor and I the rubber sole is alreading starting to sepertae from the foam. More, over there really isn;t much to the sole of the board, its just a big brick of foam from liner to the rubber grips. As mentioned no crampons really it this boot well it overall the boots footprint is really big. Don't get me wrong this boot is probably still one of the best on the market however even touring in it for a few days you will likely see that the design lacks attention to detail. I believe thirtytwo could do more to enable splitboarding rather than just dressing up its resort boots and increasing the price tag.
review.name: Needs more attention to detail

review.itemreviewed: Jones MTB BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Just like the other reviewer said, these boots are way too short for the size they indicate, they're at least 1-2 inches shorter than they should be - that's a lot! My front toes were completely curled up just to fit in this boot. Forget standing and walking, that was impossible.

I wear size 9.5 and I already own 3 other pair of snowboard boots from the ~8 years I've been riding. I have normal feet, not wide or long or unique in any way.  To find those 3 pair of good fitting boots that I already own, I've tried on dozens of boots from basically all manufacturers, and I've never had boots on my feet that were so short. I've never put on boots that I couldn't even take one step in because my toes were so cramped.

Maybe if you lost your big toe somehow in an accident these would be good, but otherwise I suggest avoiding them.
review.name: Too small - their sizing is way off

review.itemreviewed: Jones MTB BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have size 13 feet.  30.5 cm to be exact(could be a 12.5 depending on brand), which 13s are supposed to be 31 cm. 

These boots are not 13s. I could barely get my feet in and once I did my toes were bent and still jammed up against the front. I took the liner out and the liner would stretch allowing my toes to lay flat but still fully jammed.

They don't make larger sizes so had to go with another brand. Ended up going with Nirto Incline TLS in size 13. Those were true to size; slight room up front which I would guess to be exactly 0.5 cm. Still hold my feet tight.
review.name: Size 13 not 13.

name: Jones MTB BOA Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Men's

review.reviewBody: I heard that this model was good for narrow feet and that is a correct statement. I really like the grip of the sole and heel, I feel very confident on loose trails, no slippage
review.name: Great fit

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The shoes are well constructed and have a great fit, but a few issues compromise their positive attributes.
1) The slippery but durable material on the back of the heel counter causes blisters by being slippery and reduces stability by the heel sliding around.
2) The mid-sole fairly pliable and is less supportive on outward twists of the ankle than other shoes in this category.

This shoe is better suited for short trail runs on moderate to challenging terrain than long days running or hiking. The soles are very grippy but better suited to dry rather than wet rock due to the aggressive lugs.
review.name: Some Issues

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I do a lot of mountain running and scrambling in La Sportiva's mountain running shoes, like the Mutant and Bushido. I recently picked up a pair of the Ultra Raptor II because I was interested in how well they would work on very technical terrain.

The lug pattern is quite unique compared to the other La Sportiva mountain runners I have worn. The lugs altogether form a much flatter pattern with more surface area, making these shoes good for smearing and very grippy when running on technical trails. Although I still prefer my Mutants for highly technical scrambling (class 4/5), I have now worn the Ultra Raptor II a few times up the 2nd Flatiron in Boulder and they have performed well. The rubber is La Sportiva's stickiest compound, which gives the wearer an almost unsafe level of confidence in their ability to grip rock.

The shoes are a bit heavier than Mutants but also have a slightly nicer ride, especially on the downhill. I prefer the Karacal for pure trail running, but they are not quite sticky enough for the type of technical scrambling I focus on. I think of these shoes as falling somewhere between those two options, but with an extra level of protective burliness that would make them great hiking shoes if you don't need a high ankle (although they do make a version like that as well).

The fit is noteworthy, with a really good heel lockdown (for my foot, anyway), but some room for the toes to splay out in the forefoot, which is exactly what I want in a running shoe. My feet are on the narrow side, but some La Sportiva shoes are too narrow even for me. Fortunately that's not the case with these.

I think these mountain runners will work well for big alpine efforts in the shoulder season, but they are not as breathable as other options for summertime running. They're on the heavier side for trail runners, but also offer superb protection and very good traction.
review.name: Burly and Protective, but not light

name: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Destination 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Destination 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Struggles to carry Nalgene silo bottles.  My only complaint about this bag is the water bottle pocket.  The tarp like material is great for rainy days, but does not allow a water bottle to slide in under the mesh.  The mesh needs more fabric to stretch around a fatter bottle.  I wish the water bottle sleeves were wide at the bottom themselves, and an actual pocket instead of just stretchy stuff.  Getting it in and out is difficult.  Maybe a zipper or strap, to snake it smaller or bigger as needed.  Otherwise it is a great bag.  My son carries his laptop, an organizer sleeve for school supplies, a 1in binder and a book in the back section.  He carries a change of clothes in a cube, shoes, and lunch in the large pocket.  He wishes the top pocket had a little organization in it but likes it is big enough for headphones.  He would say two water bottle pockets are better than one (or a handle). The bag seems like it will hold up.  The rear being deep/wide enough to carry school and separate it from his daily stuff is great.  Not too many bags out there have a 50/50 split.  It is always one big compartment, one laptop sleeve and one organizer panel.  We really want a half and half!  Half school and half life on campus situation.  It would be great if that school back section had an organizer panel against the front wall with the laptop at the back and room for a binder, book, charging cables.  Why are we still opening two pockets (laptop and organizer panel) to get to our work/school stuff?  The front doesn’t need to be crazy with separating stuff or a shoe pocket, just one space.  The use of packing cubes and lunch boxes separate things well.  Nice bag, thanks for the option to have the rear compartment bigger than just the laptop and accommodate all of his school supplies, we are going to enjoy it.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody:
Checks all the boxes for my 6'1" active husband: 
-good day, long weekend or plane travel pack, 
-lightweight, spacious, rugged, well made
-easy access water bottle storage 
-zippered security storage for ID & wallet
-hat and glasses storage space
-padded laptop pocket
-lumbar support
It is stylish and easy to clean 
-
review.name: Rugged, Stylish & Utilitarian Backpack

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a single travel bag that worked for an every day work bag as well. This was the closest I found after buying several. A few tweaks would make it perfect. 1 - make back panel just laptop with side entry zipper. Move all the cable/electronic storage to a front area admin sleeve (basically another 3/4 zip access area behind the top hood pocket). 2 - add luggage passthrough for using with a roller bag, 3 - add a few internal organizer pockets to the top pocket.
review.name: Great bag, almost perfect, great price

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for school and for travel. It is amazing. There are so many pockets, so I am able to fit everything I need in the bag, the biggest pocket fully unzips. For travel that is so useful, it is the perfect bag for a short weekend trip. On top of that all, being a student I do not have to worry about any of my materials getting wet as the material of the bag allows water to just run right off the bag! I switched from a North Face bag and although this bag is larger, it doesn't feel too big or bulky. I would highly recommend this bag for travel, school or work, it is amazing!
review.name: Amazing Bag!!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this backpack for my son heading into the new school year. I wanted a backpack that would stand the test of time and rigor of a young man in high school.  So far, so good. He's loving his backpack and its various pockets.
review.name: 30L for High Schooler

review.reviewBody: I went on a month-long trip through Europe, and this backpack checked all the boxes. It’s spacious, organized, durable, stylish, and as comfortable as a heavy backpack can be.
review.name: Perfect Backpack for Travel

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag recently for a whirlwind weekend trip overseas. It stores a lot and pockets are very convenient. The water bottle pocket was a little small but I jammed mine in and was fine. The bag fits underneath the seat in front. The only issue I had is the placement of the shoulder straps were wide for my (female) shoulders. Another reviewer mentioned the same and it’s accurate! I used the chest strap to keep them as close together as possible while still being comfortable. 2-3” narrower would make it perfect.
review.name: Great storage but wide shoulder straps

review.reviewBody: Great backpack for everyday use or for school. I've been using it every day on campus and its been nice not having to worry about my books or laptop getting wet when it rains. The design is well thought out for the most part but there could be some improvements. The biggest problem with the pack is the fit. The shoulder straps are super far apart. I'm tall and have broad shoulders and this thing is constantly sliding off my shoulders unless I clip the chest strap. Its not a big deal for the most part but if you're wearing a rain jacket or a puffy this thing will not stay in place.
review.name: Good backpack but needs a couple changes

review.reviewBody: I picked this pack up two months ago and have since used it for biking to the cafe office, flying to meet with the grandparents, and camping storage. Two things I think this pack really excels at- compartmentalization and access. There are two main compartments- the main volume and then the back panel volume. Both volumes have very ample storage space that allows you to take ownership of how you can organize your carry items. The full clam shell style opening for these two volumes allows you to immediately and efficiently access or pack/unpack. The various grab handles and plush shoulder straps grant comfort and different ways to carry. The various pockets around the pack also function perfectly for smaller EDC items. All in all, it's an awesome pack that excels in its purpose- carry and access.
review.name: Compartmentalization and Access

review.reviewBody: This thing is built super nice and has great style points too. The zippers are those super beefy fat zippers that feel like they'll never break. I packed this thing like it should have been bursting at the seams and the zipper held it like a champ. It appears to be water resistant too as it has nice material on the outside and flashing over the zippers. It's also got straps on the side to hold skis in A-Frame, so I'll be taking this baby out in the winter too. Love it!
review.name: Awesome pack

name: Destination 30L Backpack
Destination 30L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Scarpa fan, guilty as charged. I have had Dragos, Magos and now Chimeras. My hope was that this shoe would be the love-child of the aforementioned, but the Chimera has ended up a bit short of that expectation. These were billed as stiffer than the Dragos, but with all the sensitivity they are known for. These are not stiffer than the Dragos in my opinion. The sensitivity is certainly there and I love it. Unfortunately, there is this weird dead space in the heal that is a nightmare. All of my other Scarpas do not have this and they fit/feel amazing. To be clear, the heel still works, but there is the dead-space that exists, so, not ideal. Good fun on overhung routes at Red Rocks and punchy routes at NJC.
review.name: Soft!

review.reviewBody: It's like taking drago and putting the classic boosting heel in it. Making it slightly less soft and a bit more asymmetrical.  If you liked drago you are going to love these, I mostly use them indoors and they have been doing magic. I lost a pair on the subway and got a second pair. Downsized by half a size...

description: Buy the Oakley Radar EV Path Prizm Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Radar EV Path Prizm Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Oakley Radar EV Path Prizm Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is my 7th pair of Oakleys and 3rd Radar.  I own two of the original Radars from 2006 and thought it was time to buy a new pair as lenses for my old versions are hard to come by.  I was happy to see the new radars are improved upon in every way.  They still look cool but the lenses are better with much better optics, almost like seeing the world in 4K.

I know the price is high and some may think not worth it but another reason I like these is for impact protection.  Members of the US Army use these to protect their eyes which was a big selling point for me!  You do occasionally have a rock or similar hit you in your face and I want my eyes protected.

Worth every penny to me for the safety and optics!
review.name: Oakleys really are the best

review.reviewBody: These glasses are comfortable, don?t steam up and have superb clarity. I would buy them again
review.name: Great clarity

review.reviewBody:
Prizm Road Black looks like they'd be TOO violet/rose, but once they're on, the tint is barely noticeable.  They're pleasant to look through and there is very very little distortion.  But like others have said, these DO seem to let in more light than you'd expect so they're not going to be a favorite in bright conditions. They're a good everyday color option for those who don't want the more eye catching Oakley colors.  Thanks to the arm design, the Radar EV frames stay on securely even though they're too wide for me.  ( I almost purchased the XS version but the lens selection for the XS is pitiful - Oakley doesn't even make pitch lenses for them !!! )  Now on to the not-so-great.... 

The Prizm effect is super subtle ( nonexistent ? ) on these. I just don't notice any difference between Prizm Road Black and non-prizm lenses.  I expected to see a difference in street markings and signs because thats how these 'road' lenses are marketed.  But there was no difference.  At first I thought maybe the red and green streetlights were highlighted along with the children crossing signs.  But when I did the same route in less expensive brown suglasses I had the same experience.  Even my cheapie gray sunglasses seem to allow the red and green streetlights and school crossing signs to remain brighter. So....no difference.  I just don't notice any prizm effect at all with Road Black.
review.name: Good frames but Prizm is lacking.

name: Radar EV Path Prizm Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
I have been using Ortovox gear for years but never have been able to afford a pair of their awesome ski/Alpine pants.  Point being I have used the size calculator on Ortovox's website because I will say their  size chart posted here really makes no sense and isn't accurate.  Even over estimating my waist size at a 34.5, their size calculator told me I should get a medium.  They fit perfectly except when I tried to close them.  Not even close.  I'm 6' 1 and roughly 170lbs. The legs and length are perfect but basically to get these to fit I'd need to have roughly a 29 to maybe a 30" waist.  Right now I have between a 31 and 32. I got these at such a great deal so it's disappointing as they didn't have the next size up for the discounted rate.  I'll be returning these sadly.  I then went and bought 2 other pairs of Ortovox pants that are similar to these, their 3l Ortler pants and their 3l Guardian shell pants, in various other sizes.  Obviously I'm not going to keep them all, and hoping that one will fit properly.  This review is mainly to point out sizes are odd with many Ortovox products (but when you do find your size, all their gear I have has always been awesome and very durable) I would definitely recommend going to the Ortovox website and take their simulation to find out what size might work for you but even then be prepared to possibly return for another size.  I will update this review and review the others that I have ordered( if I end up keeping any. ) I'm really hoping that one does fit because many of my friends have had these ski pants (or similar 
Ortovox hardshell pants and love them)
review.name: Awesome but odd fit:(

review.reviewBody: Can't say anything. It's perfect
review.name: Great top

review.reviewBody: Soft, stretchy and comfortable! Hoody fits much better than Tahoe Sun Hoody. Got the purple and get lots of compliments. $79 is steep and I will wait for it to go back on sale.
review.name: Great piece

review.reviewBody: Fits feels and looks exactly how I expected. Backcountry brand seems very consistent from past purchases and this lives up to that.
review.name: Exactly what I expected

review.reviewBody: You wouldn’t think you’d need a pocket.  Perfect for sunglasses.
review.name: Love the pocket

review.reviewBody: This hoodie is extremely comfortable. Feels great on skin.
review.name: Extremely comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Virtues
Extremely comfy next to the skin.

Who would have thought this is a winter garment, but it is. Its weight makes it ideal for both sitting around in layered clothing and exerting oneself outdoors in the cold. I'm amazed at what an all-purpose garment this is.

Faults:
Too baggy for an undergarment.
Silly colors
Like the Tahoe, I would like a thumb catcher on the sleeves.
review.name: The virtues outweigh the faults

review.reviewBody: I really like the feel of this hoodie. Unfortunately, after wearing it once, it got a small hole. I didn't do anything harsh with it. It just formed after a day of wear.
review.name: Feels great. Not very durable.

review.reviewBody: Good god this is one fabulous hoodie. Stretchy and comfy. It feels like butter with that much spandex woven in. Pretty much haven't even taken if off all year long even on 90 degree days now that summer has arrived. Please make more and in additional colors!
review.name: Best all around sun hoodie I've found

review.reviewBody: I'm 6' 4" 185 pounds; an XL was too baggy in the body for me, returned.  Otherwise OK.  Blue Haze is really light green.
review.name: Too baggy for me

review.reviewBody:
Finally! A sun hoody that feels great next to skin, fits well, and gets the job done with the heat is on! 

I just spent three days chasing Tarpon on the fly in the Florida Keys; with 30+ hours standing on the front of skiff in the beating sun and wind. Initially, I thought there was no way this material was going to keep me as cool as some of my other go-to synthetic sun hoodies. But I was pleasantly surprised with the performance overall, and couldn't be happier with the feel of the poly blend feel next to skin. I never felt like I was any hotter or sweatier than I was in other sun hoodies, and I'm definitely someone that runs hot. Also, the zip pocket is a very welcome and useful addition - perfect for a small fly box or a spool of tippet. 

I can't overstate how comfortable this shirt is. this new Poly blend is absolutely superior to the standard poly sunshirt blend used by other fishing companies, and seems to breath a little better than the bamboo options. 

Last but not least, it fits and looks great! I find myself wearing this shirt in much more casual situations, and will definitely be picking up the other two colors. 

So what could be improved? Really just have two additions would make this the perfect piece. 
1. Thumb loops, just to protect the hands a bit more as they are what gets hammered by the sun during most pursuits. 
2. A snap or button about 2 inches up the neck of the hood. This would help keep the sun off your neck when needed, and helps secure the hood in place over a hat on a boat or bike.
review.name: comfortable performance and protection

review.reviewBody: great material and comfortable. Fit is definitely a slimmer styling than normal. I'm usually a Medium for all tops, but this one feels tights.
review.name: great material / fit a bit tight

review.reviewBody: So, everyone loves a good hoodie, and this might be the perfect shoulder season hoodie. It's been a beautiful spring so far here in the PNW; cold in the mornings, but still kind of chilly in the afternoon. This hoodie is perfect for this weather. It's nice and warm in the morning, but doesn't seem to over heat when the sun hits it. A perfect hoodie for around the fire or those early morning inconvenient coffee bike meetups. The only low point of the hoodie is that it's sizing is a little on the smaller side. Fit's a little more like an XL than a XXL Other than that, it might be my new favorite hoodie.
review.name: A Real Nice Hoodie

author.name: OR Employee - Mikey J - Customer Service

review.reviewBody: This is hands down the softest hoodie I have ever owned. I don't ever want to take it off. Its light which is great cause you don't get to warm in it compared to traditional hoodies due to the the high quality materials used. I wish they had more colors cause I need one for everyday of the week
review.name: The softest hoodie ever

review.reviewBody:
Carry this tool everywhere I go. 

Got me out of a pinch!
review.name: GREAT

review.reviewBody:
Multi-tools are your last line of defense against the dreaded phonecall to your significant other. This tool checked all the boxes: trusted brand, all the needed tools, looks nice.

Unfortunately, today I had to use it. My derailleur hanger broke and my spare was in the car. So I pulled out my multitool and started the well-rehearsed procedure of converting my bike into a single speed by removing the derailleur, starting with getting the chain off. When I started using the chain tool, the pin snapped. Instead of single speeding back to the car, I had to coast Flinstone-style 8 miles back to my car. 

The biggest benefit of this tool was learning that it  cannot be relied on to get me out of trouble when I’m even further from civilization. Do not buy.
review.name: Chain tool breaks on the first use?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got these and love them! They stay up nicely, and you can never go wrong with wool socks. They're expensive but worth it. I haven't had them long enough to know how long they'll last but they seem well constructed - similar to the smartwool I usually buy (which last me many years). Wool socks help prevent smells too - so you're warm & not stinky - win win.
review.name: Love wool sock!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this liner sock, except that every pair I have purchased has torn at the instep meshing. It's very frustrating to have several pairs and not be able to wear them anymore. They are thin but warm and work well over tights. I came here just now hoping the design had been updated. It doesn't look as if it has.
review.name: Great except for the holes.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I first bought these for a 4 day winter camping trek 8 years ago. I used them as liners and on their own and needed to replace them. So glad they are still available!
review.name: Love these liners

review.reviewBody: I just used these for a week of hiking in Yellowstone. I had an almost-healed blister near my left bunion, but I'm breaking in new hiking boots and it aggravated the blister. I normally don't use liners with my merino hiking socks, but I put these on and they really helped. They are very light weight and not bulky, and very comfortable next to the skin. My outer socks were very wet from sweat (inside GoreTex boots), but the liners stayed nearly dry and I did not develop any new blisters. I wear an 8.5 in a regular shoe and 9 in hiking/running shoes and the medium fit great. Would definitely buy them again.
review.name: Just what I needed!

name: Hike Liner Crew Sock - Women's

hasVariant.name: NanoWave 45 Sleeping Bag: 45F Synthetic
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot NanoWave 45 Sleeping Bag: 45F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had this bag for two summers now, I'm 5'9",180lb so pretty average, and this bag is slightly too narrow at the shoulders, I very rarely zip past the elbows. I love the weight and size though. Will probably give it to my son to replace his kids version and find a slightly wider bag for myself. If you are broader than normal is avoid this bag.
review.name: Great summer bag, but narrow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was very happy when I received this sleeping bag. It is compact, lightweight and will work great for summer camping. Also the fabric has a soft feel so will be great to sleep on instead of the typical plastic feel of synthetic material. I have not used the bag yet, but will update after use.
review.name: compact light sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Packs up small and was perfect for nights dipping into the low 50s
review.name: Great for warm weather camping

review.reviewBody: Been using my Nanowave 45 for 5+ years now and its all you'll need in a warm weather sleeping bag: light, low volume, and warm.
review.name: Everything You Want In A Warm Weather Bag

review.reviewBody:
I know that these ratings tend to vary given how well the person using the sleeping bag handles the cold and other weather factors. But after this past weekend, I'm fairly confident this is closer rated to 50 degrees than 45. 

I was camping around Asheville, NC this weekend for 3 nights and tested this out in actually cold weather (40s and 50s versus 60s and 70s, which is what I tested it at last time). It worked fairly well but I give it about a B- for how it handles actually cold weather. 

The tempertures for the weekend were between 45ish and 55ish and on the 45ish night I was bundled up in 2 tops, a beanie, very thick Smartwool socks and Smartwool thermal base layer pants and I was just warm enough. Even at 55ish I was wearing extra clothes to keep me warm and, as far as I'm concerned, if a sleeping bag is rated for a temperature, I should be able to use it in just my underwear...or at least very minimal clothing.

Still, I love that it's so compact and otherwise well-made. It definitely does the trick for almost 45 degrees.
review.name: Probably rated closer to 50 degrees

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have used it once already and it's very comfortable and kept me cozy
review.name: It is very small and convenient for my camping hik

review.reviewBody: The large size bag is heavier than the claimed weight.  2 lbs 8 oz, not 2 lbs even.
review.name: Heavier

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very happy with this sleeping bag for warm evenings that extend into chilly nights - spring, fall and high elevation summer camping. I took this summer backpacking though Alaska and it packs down in it’s cinch sack and is lightweight. When I used the conch sack as a daypack in town, one of the outfitters said he had the same one and did the same thing with it (used as daypack). Great minds think alike. Super comfortable and love the material. Not a sweaty layer of plastic at all. Machine washes great.
review.name: Lasted the test of time

review.reviewBody: The price is great, the packability, is great, and the quality is great. So I wanted to love this as a perfect value bag. However, my first night trying it and the pros are balanced by a few cons. Caveats are that I?m a side sleeper and this was my first time using a mummy bag. The bag is nice to the touch and fairly easy to zip. However I felt claustrophobic when I zipped this up! With one zipper on the left, it?s difficult to reach over with your right hand to unzip, particularly if you?re in a hurry to open it. The fit was awkward for me, so the hood ended up bunched or dangling behind my head all night. It was warm enough on a 60? night, almost too warm for me, so I ended up unzipping it. This might work better for some, but this will not be a go-to bag for me unless I need to save space.
review.name: Wanted to love this

review.reviewBody: Love this for warmer nights. I was camping 4 nights on the Green River Utah. One night got a bit too cold for this bag, but I have no idea what the temp was. Could have been 40 degrees. Not sure.  Other nights were maybe 50 degrees at night and I was perfectly comfortable
review.name: Great summer bag

name: NanoWave 45 Sleeping Bag: 45F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got this for my camping quilt and it’ll hold a whole lot more too, now I have to rethink my packing…😄
review.name: Works great and holds a lot more than I thought

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these sack to keep everything organized in my pack
review.name: Compression sacks

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really happy with my 20 Liter compression sack. I use it for travel packing.
It compressed my clothes with minimal effort and minimal wrinkled garments. Very easy to use and sturdy. I definitely recommend this and my brother-in-law bought two based on my suggestion!
See my 'before' and 'after' pictures!!
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this compression sack it has lasted me a while and I have used this same still for upwards of 2 years and I love it, it is the best combination of lightweight without sacrificing durability along the way.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased one of each of these packs for my daughter and son in law for Christmas because they are frequent travelers who like to contain their luggage to carry ons and a backpack each, especially when traveling internationally. They also go skiing a couple times a year and on that trip they have to pack very bulky jackets, ski pants, sweaters and lots of layers of clothes. They have not traveled with them yet, but they did do an experiment with stuffing one of them and they were amazed at what they were able to pack and how small they were to shrink the sack down to! They can't wait to use them next month for a ski trip. I have now decided to buy one for myself.
review.name: Ultra-Sil Compression Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used almost daily on our 9 week backpacking trip! Sturdy, easy to use, compressed easily,
review.name: Great compression sack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like so many Sea to Summit products this one delivers on all expectations. Light, water resistant (bordering on waterproof) and well made. Keep up the great work STS!!!
review.name: Another great Sea to Summit purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these for a beach vacay, with the hopes of compressing all my clothes, swim suits, etc to avoid a checked bag. I haven't gone on the trip yet, but I did test how many clothes it could stuff using clothes I had piled up in my hamper. I was very impressed, it could definitely hold more than a weeks outfits. the straps felt very durable. I was using my whole body weight and pulling as tight as I could, and the straps still felt like they weren't gonna budge. I'm very excited to be taking these on my trip, I'm looking forward to not having a huge mess of clothes and being able to comfortably pack other things in my carry on. Looking forward to using these on future trips!
review.name: Really well done!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Literally reduces the size of what I am packing to less than half. Will never go on a trip without this.
review.name: Necessity for packing

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I fly with carry-on luggage only, so being to get everything into my carry-on backpack is critical. These work extremely well for that purpose.I pack only synthetic clothes which don’t wrinkle, so crushing my clothes down is no problem.

Be sure to loosen all the straps when you unpack them, otherwise the shape of the tube will be uneven when you pack them next, and you won’t be able to pack them as efficiently. I think it’s helpful to own a few different sizes.
review.name: Will never travel without them.

name: Ultra-Sil 8L Compression Sack
