review.reviewBody: I originally purchased a 9 they were very tight in the top of the foot with any sock. Traded for a 9.5 and could not be happier. The waterproofing will remain to be seen. Hoping for the beat. Cannot wait for this high Colorado Mountain winter.
review.name: Love Them

review.reviewBody: I was shopping for boots that would work well for snowshoeing.  These Oboz boots and the Keen Revel IV High Polar Boot were the finalists.  I have narrow feet, but I also have a bunion on my right foot.  The Oboz fit like a glove, maybe a little tight (I tried them on with thick socks, same size as the Keens), but the toe box wasn't as roomy as the Keens.  I even stood/walked around with the Keens on one foot, the Oboz on the other for a couple hours to test after my feet swelled a little.  Ultimately decided to stick with the Keens for bunion insurance.  :)
review.name: So Close!

review.reviewBody: I have worn Oboz hiking boots for years. This is my first pair of winter ones. I have not had the chance to wear them in snow yet so will update this review when I do. I plan on wearing them to snow shoe this year. I have never been disappointed with Oboz and their comfort is why I purchased the winter insulated dry boot. I war a thicker sock so buy size 9. I usually wear an 8 but an 8.5 in running shoes.
review.name: OBOZ doesn't disappoint!

name: Bridger 9in Insulated B-Dry Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Works great for being able to mount and dismount my Roam quickly. This mount is easy to position for optimal viewing. The only tiny drawback, and why I don’t give five stars is that the screw to tighten is a little small and I was hesitant to crank it down super tight. So, in bumpy terrain it would rotate on my aerobar at a little. It was no big deal and I was on a bike tour and didn’t want to break it. Now that I’m back, I’ll crank it tighter and see. Definitely a value for the price. Would recommend.
review.name: Definitely worth the price. Would recommend.

comment: Hello Tyy, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry Women's Caribou™ Royal Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: I wish every day were cold enough to wear these boots. Excellent tread, no slipping or sliding. Really warm with a comfortable foot bed for extended wear. Very water proof, and stylish to top it off. I look forward to the days when I have to break these out. I ordered for my size. They are a little smaller than I expected, but I still fit them even with a thick sock. Fit my wide feed perfectly.

review.reviewBody: They sure do keep my feet warm--great for snow but terrible for slick surfaces (eg, NYC subway stations). I sized up for wide feet and just wear two pairs of socks for a good fit. These are definitely fashion over function, but I got a lot of compliments at work!

hasVariant.name: Air Stream Pump Dry Sack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Air Stream Pump Dry Sack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really cuts down the time needed to inflate my sleeping pad. What a great product.
review.name: Air Stream dry sack pump

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this Air Stream pump for five years, anywhere from 2-4 weeks of backpacking each year. It still works to inflate my mattress, but the seam tape failed and fell off after four years so I replaced it with sil-net seam sealer, made for sil-nylon fabric. I will say that it never filled the mattress in three rounds, more like 6-8. 
As a stuff sack it is big, my down quilt only fills half of it. It would be easy to fit even a winter sleeping bag in it.
review.name: Still working, seam seal replaced

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Breath saver,ease of inflation perfect size to stow great idea from sea to summit.
review.name: Breath saver,ease of inflation perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pump! Very compact and easy to pack. Works like a charm. Very pleased.
review.name: Great pump! Very compact and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent for inflating my Sea to Summit sleeping pad. Much easier, faster and more sanitary than blowing into the pad. I had an older dry sack pump that failed in the seam seals and Sea to Summit replaced it without question. New sack works great;
review.name: Replacement dry sack pump

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this pump to use with the comfort deluxe mattress. It is very light and does a good job. I recommend the pump if you are buying a sea to summit sleeping pad.
review.name: Great pump

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Simplify your life. Just get one. You can thank me later.
review.name: Best Timesaver Ever

review.reviewBody:
(Purchased in the last month at REI)
It is about 14 in. x 23 in. flat. It is about 8 in. in diameter and roughly 17 in. long when full but not clipped closed. When inflating I found I had to fold it about 5 times before I clipped it to not let air escape through the top. I believe when you fold it you want to do it the side that has the gray flat strip on the outside. I like the size of the sack. A Sea to Summit CAMP PLUS SELF-INFLATING SLEEPING MAT - rectangular large fits inside of it in case anyone wanted to know. I do not plan on using this as a fill sack attached to my pack because it seems too thin... it also doesn't have many places to clip on the outside on my pack. I have a dry bag for water sports and in comparison this sack does not seem like it is an actual water-proof dry bag more likely water resistant (but I have not tested that). The valve and fabric flap at the bottom is sufficient and long enough to not have to worry about it disconnecting when inflating a pad... which is good because it was one of my main concerns about buying this. It took multiple sack fills to completely fill my pad but it is a 3 inch thick - 6 ft 7 in. long - 25 in. wide pad which is bigger than most sleeping pads. This sack is a lot smaller packed than I expected. It is 3.25 in. x 7.75 in. and 1 in. thick in the thickest spot where the valve is... which is small at about the size of a scientific calculator or your hand. At 48g it weighs almost nothing. It also folds back into its packed size easily.
review.name: Good Air Pump Sack

review.reviewBody: The larger bag filler does a much faster job than my older accordion style inflator. I also like to use it as a waterproof bag to protect my sleeping bag in my pack.
review.name: Nice easy mat filler, doubles as a stuff sack

review.reviewBody: Simple like the best ideas are. Avoids huffing and puffing. No moving parts to break. And doubles in its off-duty time as a dry sack. Highly recommend!
review.name: Simple like the best ideas

name: Air Stream Pump Dry Sack

review.reviewBody: New helmet look great, fits great but chin strap too small--too bad!
review.name: great helmet--too small strap!

review.reviewBody:
Measured 22.5" head size and used the Proframe sizing since the Speedframe sizing wasn't on the speed chart - but the M was too tight and felt a few spots in back when fully extended.

When I buckled it, the strap was completely taut and uncomfortable.  I want a few fingers' gap in there.  

I returned and am pretty annoyed at paying the $6.99 return fee to Backcountry because they didn't have the correct size chart to begin with.  Grrr...do better Backcountry.
review.name: Too Small - Size Chart Inaccurate

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and fits good.
review.name: Recommend

review.reviewBody: I know that the look should not be the first thing here, but let's be honest; everyone wants to look nice, even when working out. The helmet fits perfectly, and I forget that I am even wearing it and feel confident wearing it. Material is light but strong enough to protect me. I love the product; great design.
review.name: Looks perfect

review.reviewBody: I got this helmet based on many positive reviews and have only been somewhat happy, I wore it mountain biking exclusively for at least a year thru all the temps one experiences in western Montana.  The helmet itself is very comfy and feels light on my head.  My dissatisfaction comes from even during early morning MTB rides when it's cool out, I noticed I was getting pretty hot and my head was sweating like crazy during hillclimbs.  The other thing I noticed was the helmet didn't vent hardly at all as speed increased, say on the flats or downhill sections.  I mean I couldn't feel any cooling at all especially compared to other older helmets I have which weren't fit to continue wearing from a safety standpoint.  Now I only wear the Speedframe when I am commuting or  wintertime romps on my road bike.  (I did purchase a 100% Altec helmet and love it, not perfect but very good, excellent ventilation!)
review.name: Comfy but poor ventilation

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet for the brand reputation and looks, the dual-density foam, and it felt good in store. When I got home and tried to fit it, I realized the Y-junction of the strap on each side is completely non-adjustable. This means this junction is a full inch or more below my ear. Even with the strap snug, this allows too much play between helmet and head. Another unfortunate design issue is the visor does not readily come off so you will always have to ride with the visor even when it does not make sense to do so.
review.name: Really Nice-Looking but Weird Strap/Fit

review.reviewBody: Love the Speedframe Pro. Lightweight and aired out well but the problem that I had with it was the magnetic clip. Clip worked amazing until I crashed and landed on my head. The magnetic clip instantly released and left me hitting my bare head on the ground. Will not be getting a helmet with a magnetic clip again.
review.name: Good helmet but clip is misleading

review.reviewBody:
I just got this helmet recently and I can tell it is going to be awesome. The only hiccup I have is that I accidentally got one that was too big! Putting it on it felt super light and comfortable and the straps went nicely around my ears without rubbing them. I absolutely loved the Fidlock magnetic buckle too! The shape of the helmet was really nice and I can tell that when I get the next size down it will be awesome. Wish I could say more on how it felt while I was riding with it but I haven't had the opportunity to yet! I'll update my review once I am able to! I got the Large and I have a 58.5 Cm head, it was barely too big and I could move the shell around my head. Size chart says that the Large starts at 59 CM and the Medium ends a 58 CM so I know the medium will work great for me!


**UPDATE**

I just got my medium helmet in and it fits perfectly! It is super comfy and doesn't look bulky on my head! Can't wait to put it to the test on bike!
review.name: High Quality, Looks Great, Super Light

review.reviewBody:
This helmet is so light, and comfortable that its easy to forget that it is on my head.
The extra liner that is included is an amazing touch.  Living in a hot humid environment can make for some sweaty rides, where the liner will surely need to be replaced before the helmet in most cases.  Great forethought from Fox to include another one up front.  
These forehead vents might be the best I have seen so far.  

When its time for a new helmet, I wouldn't hesitate to pick up a second one of these!
review.name: Really Great

review.reviewBody: This is one of the best feeling helmets I have worn in a long time. I have used Smith, Giro, and Lazer helmets and found the fit on this one to be near perfect for me. The padding on the inside of the helmet is also a little more substantial than other brands out there adding to the comfort of the helmet. It also breaths well so you won't have to worry about getting a hot head while riding in this helmet. Overall this is a great-looking and feeling helmet that will protect your noggin on the trail!
review.name: Great Feeling Helmet

name: Speedframe Mips Pro Helmet

review.reviewBody: These are great gloves, warm and durable, but the sizing is extremely snug. After a few wears they have loosed up just enough to where I don't have to struggle to pull them on. If you sweat at all be careful to hold the finger tips in place when removing the glove as the liner will pull out. Despite being snug these are great gloves and if they were true to size they would easily receive 5 stars.
review.name: Very tight fit

review.reviewBody:
My hands are always cold, they?re cold as I write this in my house . I wear gloves for running until it?s 50-55.  I?ve worn these several times on runs down to 17F, my hands were always toasty. They probably don?t breath quite enough. They keep heat and moisture in and I definitely start sweating, leaving the gloves damp, and wanting to pull the liner layer inside out when taking them off.  That said, i forgot to leave them out to dry and used them damp the next day, in the 20?s and my hands were still warm. I can imagine that they would be good down to 32F while on long road rides. Maybe lower if you?re hands are warm.   Weather has been so bad I can?t make myself get on the bike for long rides. 
For non-bulky gloves I can wear while running and a little padding while riding, these are fantastic. 
The size large fit my skinny, long hands very well. Would be tight on fatter fingers, the cuff does not stretch much. They?re tight to get on, Velcro closure isn?t necessary.  For those reasons I say they run small. I bought 8 different pairs of gloves and these were the best fit and feel. Pretty well priced too.
review.name: Fantastic gloves, the luck of the fit

name: Strike Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: This vest is amazing BUT the US sizing is way off.  I'm typically a size 4-6 US depending on the brand.  I ordered an 8 US based on reviews saying it runs small and I couldn't even get it on (it fits my size 2 US daughter perfectly btw).  I ended up returning and ordering a size 12. Fingers crossed this one fits.
review.name: Great vest BUT sizing is way off!

review.reviewBody: Based on Barbour size recommendations and those here, went with my normal US 6. Utter Fail. Way too small.  Return and wait for next try.  Had to go up to US 10 for proper fit. This allows for decent base layer but not bulky sweaters.  Measured flat, armpit to armpit the US 10 is just barely 20inches one side. Smallest point near waist is about 17”. Zero stretch.  Love the angled pockets and that it covers most of the rear without looking dowdy due to angle there as well. Black is classic and great with everything, but beware the sizing!
review.name: Took 2 tries for sizing

review.reviewBody: I tried two sizes - one from BackCountry and another direct from Barbour. The larger one from Barbour was very long waisted and too big in the chest, while the smaller one from BC was the right length and chest size but hard to zip up, like a wasp waist. Too fitted for an outer layer. Never had this issue with Barbour or with vests before. Both are going back.
review.name: Cut is odd

name: Cavalry Gilet Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm hat that stays on! Keeps our toddlers face and ears warm.
review.name: Fits well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this as a lightweight gift to mail friends overseas. It’s super cute and with the ear flaps, I imagine it’ll be toasty for their little boy too.
review.name: Cute and warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This had is precious and well made. My son has a head circumference of 50 cm and it fits him perfect if not a little snug.
review.name: Cute and comfy.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been getting these for my grandkids from day one. These are the best hats you can buy for winter. They go on easy, they stay on, and the kids can’t take them off easily. My daughter loves them and daycare has often told her her kids have the best hats.
review.name: BEST HAT YOU CAN BUY

review.reviewBody: Just the best hat for toddlers.  Both my kids have a hard time keeping hats on. These beanies secure without fear of choking and are so snuggly and warm, not to mention cute.
review.name: Winning little kids' hat, hands down

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits great to my 22 month old son! He loves it and it snugs his head
review.name: Warm and cute

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and cute . Fits perfectly to my 6 month old baby and a little tight to my 4 year old .
review.name: Sooo cute

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Our 2-year-old loves this hat so much we had to buy a second one after he lost the first. We've felt comfortable keeping it on down to about 0 degrees Fahrenheit for quick trips to the car. Below that and for longer periods of time outdoors we've switched to a bulkier hat. Bonus that it's super cute and old ladies at the mall love it too.
review.name: Cute and effective

review.reviewBody: I was gifted the infant version of this and it was the only hat she tolerated. More than that, she actually liked it. It looked ADORABLE and the ties helped it stay on. I just bought the toddler size to be ready for next winter.
review.name: Super Cute and Actually Stayed On

review.reviewBody: This fits perfectly, it's warm and easy to tie..Plus I like the little ears on top.
review.name: Tiny Ones

name: Tiny Animal II Beanie - Toddlers'

description: Buy the Klymit Cross Canyon Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cross Canyon Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Cross Canyon Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Easy setup, sturdy and light, great for family camping for the price.
review.name: Great tent!

review.reviewBody:
Needed tent big enough to spend two weeks in while working out of a fire camp. This one fits the bill, while not being annoyingly huge.

Seems well built and worked well on my two trips out this year.
review.name: Perfect for Fire Camp

review.reviewBody: We've taken this 2 man tent out a few times on backpacking trips. Most recently in Nov.   Boy scouts were able to assemble with ease.  Very light and compact.    Only thing which I would change is the carrying sleeve.  It can be a bit challenging to get the ends into the case.
review.name: cross canyon tent

review.reviewBody: Needed a new tent because I purchased the REI kingdom cots for my husband and I. The size was perfect to accommodate both cots. Easy to set up, zippers worked. Plenty of stash pockets. Great tent.
Very easy to set up, very roomy tent. Had 2 large tall men using it, had plenty of room for us and our gear.
review.name: Amazing tent!

review.reviewBody: The tent is fairly easy to set up. I much prefer the clip style rigging that Klymit chose opposed to the sleeve style so many tents use. Tent can be put up and taken down incredibly quickly. The aluminum poles make me nervous as they're incredibly light weight. Plenty of ventilation and the colors are pretty nice too. The zipper quality is mediocre at best.
review.name: Checks the boxes for us

review.reviewBody:
It's a good tent, but not perfect.  

Likes:  
-  Bought on sale and it was definitely more bang for the buck.
-  Easy to put up.  Perfect for the first time car camper.
-  Vertical Space inside the tent makes it easy to move around when putting on clothes or sitting up.
-  Spacious and floor space is great.  
-  Big doors, easy in/easy out day or night.  
-  Lots of ventilation, and you can go topless on a perfect night to enjoy the stars.

Dislikes:
- Zipper bind after the fourth use.  Because this tent is already heavy adding a zipper with a better track less prone to binding would be a nice upgrade.
-  Detachable overhead gear hammock.  Junk design.  It falls down everytime the doors are zipped or unzipped.
- Doors, love the opening, dislike the attachement.  They are sewn into the top center of the opening, but are always in the way unless you roll them up (not ideal in mosquito country).
-  Doesn't come with a foot print.
-  Tent Stakes are weak and bend when encountering the slightest resistance.
review.name: Tent Review

review.reviewBody: Great little 2-person tent. Easy to set up and break down. Nice sturdy materials. No complaints yet!
Easy to set up. Like all the mesh. Great price. Very roomy.
review.name: Easy to set up. Like
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: Sets up super easy. Kinda small for 2 people taller than 6ft tall and gear. Wish it was a bit lighter for backpacking.
review.name: Easy to setup and durable material

name: Cross Canyon Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the SRAM GX Eagle 12-Speed Grip Shifter online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GX Eagle 12-Speed Grip Shifter
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM GX Eagle 12-Speed Grip Shifter online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this to convert my DeVinci Deore bike to shift the way God intended you to shift. Grip Shift for Life!
review.name: GX Eagle 12Spd Grift Shift

review.reviewBody:
They still make these?  Who knew. I have either carpal tunnel or arthritis or both and my thumbs really hurt during the winter, wearing winter gloves and operating regular shifters. I figured can’t hurt to try these. They actually installed really easy on my Supercaliber 9.8GX, it’s taken a couple rides to get used to them. But, they seem to work well and my thumbs are happy.  

Haven’t taken them on very technical ride yet, but I don’t foresee any problem.
review.name: Gripshift - really!!

name: GX Eagle 12-Speed Grip Shifter

hasVariant.description: Buy the Dale of Norway Vail Weatherproof Sweater - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I didn't get mine from Backcountry but have had it a couple years now.  I wear it most only bluebird days, resort skiing.  I bought it big so I could layer underneath; I usually go with an L in Dale of Norway.  It really keeps the wind out and sheds snow and water very well.  I took a tumble on a powder this season and all I had to do was shake it off once and I was good to go.
review.name: this sweater rules

name: Vail Weatherproof Sweater - Men's
